intro: Dichapetalum glabratum, commonly known as the smoothleaf dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in the understory of forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
